qas.question: When was the second decline of mandolin popularity?
Why was the second decline in popularity not a strong as the first?

answers.text: Thousands of people had learned to play the instrument

qas.question: What are two types of new mandolins the Luthiers created?
What types of music did musicians begin to play the mandolins in?

answers.text: Celtic, Bluegrass, Jazz and Rock-n-Roll styles — and Classical too.

plausible_answers.text: Celtic, Bluegrass, Jazz and Rock-n-Roll styles — and Classical too.

plausible_answers.text: Thousands of people had learned to play the instrument

qas.question: What types of music did musicians never play the mandolins in?

context: The second decline was not as complete as the first. <a1_0><b9_0>Thousands of people had learned to play the instrument<b9_0/><a1_0/>. Even as the second wave of mandolin popularity declined <b5_0>in the <a0_0><b8_0>early 20th century<b8_0/><b5_0/>,<a0_0/> new versions of the mandolin began to be used in new forms of music. <a2_0><b6_0><b10_0>Luthiers<b10_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> created the resonator mandolin, the flatback mandolin, the carved-top or arched-top mandolin, the <a3_0>mandolin-banjo and the <b11_0>electric mandolin<b11_0/><a3_0/>. Musicians began playing it in <a4_0><b7_0><b12_0>Celtic, Bluegrass, Jazz and Rock-n-Roll styles — and Classical too<b12_0/>.
